makers.displaymaker: Eugène Delacroix, 1798–1863; born Clarenton-Saint Maurice, France; died Paris, France

texts.textentryhtml: Delacroix sale, Paris, February 1864, lot 212; Baron Paul de Laage, Paris; Paris Hôtel Drouot, 23 May, 1873, lot 15, to Soutzo; Sedelmeyer sale, Paris, Hôtel Drouot, 30 April, 1877, lot 26, to Perreau; Galerie Thannhauser, Lucerne; bought 25 August, 1921, by Rudolf Staechelin (1881-1946), Basel; by descent to his son, Peter Staechelin, Basel; W. M. Brady & Co., Inc., New York; 1996 purchase by Princeton University Art Museum.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Art Museum 1996," Record of the Art Museum, Princeton University 56, no. 1/2 (1997): p. 75-115.
